gurmukhi: ju`Du BXo bhuqo iqh TwN qb mUsl kau muslI jU sMBwrXo ] kY bl hwQn doaun kY kib sXwm khY qik qwih pHwrXo ]
transliteration: Juddh(u) Bhayo Bahouto Tih Thaan Tab Moondal Kau Mouslijoo Sanbhdaryo|| Kai Bal Haathan Don Kai Kabiu Syaam Kahai Lak(i) Taah(i) Prahdaryo||
translation: After the continuation of war for a long time, Balram held his huge mace and powerfully struck it with both the hands on the enemy;

gurmukhi: lwgq Gwie huvY mr gXo Air AMqih ky Pun Dwm isDwrXo ] XO blBdR hnXo iqn ko sB ib`pn ko Pun kwj svwrXo ]2401]
transliteration: Laagad Ghaae Huvai Mar Gyo Ar(i) Antah(i) Ke Phoun Dhaam Sidhdaryo|| Yau Balbhadra Hanyo Tin Ko Sabh Bippan Ko Phoun Kaaj Savdaryo||2401||
translation: When the blow struck him, he died and went to the next world; in this way killing him, Balram completed the task assigned to him by the Brahmins.2401.

gurmukhi: paurK jo muslI Dir ko kihE so niRp kau suKdyv sunwXo ] jwih kQw idj ky muK qy sB sRaun sunI iqnhUM suK pwXo ]
transliteration: Paurakh Jo Mouslidhar(i) Ko Kahio So Nrip Kau Soukhdev Sounaayo|| Jaah(i) Kathaa Dij Ke Moukh Te Sabh Srooun Sounitinhoon Soukh Paayo||
translation: In this way, Shukdev related the bravery of Balram to the king; whosoever has heard this story from the mouth of a Brahmin, he obtained happiness;

gurmukhi: jw ky kIey ss sUr insw idv qwhI kI bwq suno jIA AwXo ] qwhI kI bwq sunwau idjoqm bydn kY joaU Byd n pwXo ]2402]
transliteration: Jaa Ke Keee Sas Soor Nisaa Div Taahikibaat Souno Jeea Aayo|| Taahikibaat Sounaao Dijotam Bedan Kai Jooo Bhed Na Paayo||2402||
translation: “He, whose creation are the sun and moon, and day and night we should listen to his words. O great Brahmin ! relate the story of Him, whose secret has not even been comprehended by the Vedas.2402.

gurmukhi: jwih Krwnn sy shswnn Koj rhy kCu pwr n pwXo ] sXwm BnY ijh kau cqurwnn bydn ky gun BIqr gwXo ]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Kharaanan Se Sahsaann Kho Jrahe Kachh(u) Paar Na Paayo|| Syaam Bhanai Jih Kau Chaturaanan Bedan Ke Goun Bheetar Gadyo||
translation: “He, whom, Kartikeya and Sheshnaga searched and got tired, but they could not know His end; He, who has been eulogised by Brahma in the Vedas.

gurmukhi: Koj rhy iSv sy ijh AMq AnMq kihE Qk AMq n pwXo ] qwhI kI bwq suno qumry muK qy sukdyv iehY ThrwXo ]2403]
transliteration: Khoj Rahe Shiv Se Jih Ant Anant Kahio Thak Ant Na Paayo|| Taahikibaat Souno Toumre Moukh Te Soukdev Ihai Thahraayo||2403||
translation: “He, whom Shiva etc. had been searching, but could not know His Mystery; O Shukdev ! relate to me the story of that Lord.”2403.

gurmukhi: BUpiq jO ieh BwNiq khXo suk kau su khUM ieh BwNiq sunweI ] dIn idAwl kI bwq sunwvq hau quih kau quih Bydu CpweI ]
transliteration: Bhoopat(i) Jau Eh Bhaant(i) Kahyo Souk Kau Su Kahoon Eh Bhaant(i) Sounaaee|| Deen Diaal Kibaat Sounaavat Hau Tuh(i) Kau Tuh(i) Bhed(u) Chhapaaee||
translation: When the king said this, then Shukdev replied, “I am relating to you the mystery of that Merciful Lord, who is the support of the oppressed;

gurmukhi: ibpR sudwmw huqo ibpqw iqh kI hau khau hir jYsy imtweI ] so hau sunwvq hau quih kau sun lY soaU sRaunn dY niRprweI ]2404]
transliteration: Bipra Sudaama Houto Biptaa Tih Kihau Kahau Har(i) Jaise Mitaaee|| So Hau Sounaavat Hau Tuh(i)(i) Kau Soun Lai Sooo Sraounan Dai Nripraaee||2404||
translation: “Now I relate this how the Lord removed the suffering of the Brahmin named Sudama; O king! now I relate that, listen attentively;”2404.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMDy purwxy bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnw Avqwry blBdR qIrQ ieSnwn kir dYq ko mwrq giH ko Awvq Bey iDAwie ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sikandhe Puraane Bachitra Naatak Granthe Krisshnaa Avtdare Balbhadra Teerath Ishnaan Kar(i) Dait Ko Maarat Grah(i) Ko Aavat Bhae Dhiaae||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Brahma came home after taking bath at pilgrim-stations and killing the demon” in Krishnavatara (Dasham Skandh Purana) in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of the episode of Sudama
